archimate:BusinessProcess.name: MSG-3 Analysis
archimate:BusinessProcess.documentation:
MSG-3 analysis can start even if Design Office has not reach a high level of maturity. For MSG-3 analysis: extract of data from CorePDM and CATIA --- From each analysis, MSG-3 generates the reports are validated by authorities (MRBR). Each report is reviewed. Up to 10 working group a year are organized to review 6 to 10 reports per working group. The required Input for these analysis: - VPM/CATIA: maturity required low ; - Describing document ; - Functional Hazard Analysis (FHA) based on indexes from Design Office: System Safety Assessment, FMECA, Reliability data - GSE - Testability analysis (BIT : Built In test & HUMS) - SSI analysis require more mature DMU and BOM Workload : half a week to produce a report (~2man/week). Once reviewed by Airworthiness authority, the rework/update is about 10% of the activity. After each report is delivered, the MSG-3 consolidates the information to deliver a MRBR. The MRBR is delivered before EIS of the machine and is then updated once a year because of: - Product changes - New rules ; - Retex from operators.
MRBR used by Tech Pub to produce the Master Servicing Manual. The MRBR delivery occurs ~9 months before EIS.
For each ECP, MSG-3 impact are analyzed: 5% of ECP imply a drastic impact on MSG-3 analysis. Note that 1 people is focused on impact analysis and 2 people to update the analysis and reports. The main pains are: - No described process for MSG-3 when H175 program started. The DOA is not updated. In the DOA it is mentioned that the DO shall run the MSG-3. Consequence at organization level. - No access to the data: 43% of time is spent to search for information from design office to perform MSG-3 analysis. - Difficult to commit on planning and budget. - The collaboration work with System Design Reponsible (DSR) depends upon the DSR (e.g.: lead-time to get the documents to be signed). - Maturity of information
